728408f-b.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Clay Pit Road
728408f-b.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, east of Clay Pit Noad, showing the Hughes house. It is situated about 700 yards back of ths road on the shore of Arthur Kill and can be reached by a private driveway. The entrance to the property is next to 4037 Arthur
Kill Road.
Spring, 1924
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A barn on the Hughes property.
Spring, 1924
P. L. Sperr
728408f-b.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Clay Pit Road, Staten Island, NY

728409f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Clay Pit Road
728409f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, about 100 yards oast of Clay Pit Road. It appears on the 1853 to 1898 maps as a Storer house. From 1907 to 1917 it is shown to be on the Killmeyer property. The house is 800 years back of the Road, on the Arthur
Kill shore.
Spring, 1924
P. L. Sperr
728409f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Clay Pit Road, Staten Island, NY

728411f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Clay Pit Road
728411f-a.text:
Arthur Kill Road, north side, east of Clay Pit Road, showing beach-plum blossoms in a field along the road.
May S, 1929
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr
728411f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Clay Pit Road, Staten Island, NY

728381f-a.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Clay Pit Road
728381f-a.text:
4037 Arthur Kill Road, north side, east of Clay Pit Road. This house is on the Dixon Hughes estate. The main Hughes house stands about 700 yards directly behind this house, on the Arthur Kill shore.
October 6, 1927
P. L. Sperr
728381f-a.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Clay Pit Road, Staten Island, NY

728410f-b.text:
Arthur Eill Road, near Clay Pit Road, showing honeysuckle and beach-plum blossoms.
View 1: June 17, 1929
Views 2, 3: May 5, 1930
P. L. Sperr

728412f-b.title: Richmond: Arthur Kill Road - Clay Pit Road
728412f-b.text:
(1)
Arthur Kill Road, north side, west of Clay Pit Road (about 500 yards). This old house is located on property belonging to the heirs of Mary J. Johnson (1917). In 1907 it belonged to the Arthur Eill Land and Water Front Company and in 1898 to J.E. and Anna C. Winant. The dates refer to
Msp9 upon which the owners' names appeslf.
P. L. Sperr  June 7, 1928
(2) The same, at a later date, showing the east side of the
house.
P. L. Sperr  May 5, 1930
(3)
A close-up of the house.
P. L. Sperr  May 5, 1930
728412f-b.folder: Arthur Kill Road & Clay Pit Road, Staten Island, NY
